newsitem.title: USA: Medaphis Corp auditors raise doubts.
newsitem.headline: Medaphis Corp auditors raise doubts.

text.p: Medaphis Corp on Monday said its auditors had substantial doubts about the company's ability to meet a part of its senior credit facility and to continue as a going concern.

Medaphis said the auditors' statement, included in the company's annual report, did not indicate Medaphis's prospects for divesting its Healthcare Recoveries Inc unit, either through an initial public offering or by finding a strategic buyer.
The company said it was confident that it would be able to divest the unit, enabling it to meet the terms of the "step-down" provision of its credit agreement.
Medaphis said the lack of a binding contract to sell Healthcare Recoveries prompted the auditors to include the statement.
